title: The Astin Family – Hurricane Survivors
content:
Tweet [embedded content]  Tweet [embedded content] 
The Astin family was living peacefully in Rockaway, New York when Hurricane Sandy struck, destroying their home and way of life. Instead of rebuilding on land, the Astins decided to pursue a different type of fresh start – at sea. The family of four has been living on their sailboat for the past three years, playing music as Stell and Snuggs, and loving the adventure. It was a treat having Jarad, Christel, Arden and Riley on the show to hear their incredible story. 
 
What inspired the decision to live on a sailboat? 
 
While living on a sailboat might seem a long way from reality for most, it was already an important part of the Astin’s life. Jarad tells us that sailing had always been important to them – they bought their own boat in 2005, and had alwasy loved spending time on it as a family. “We loved it” says Jarad, and “we always thought about doing it down the line.” Luckily, that same boat survived the storm, and when the family lost their place to live, they were presented with a freeing opportunity. “We had no lease, nothing holding us back” says Jarad. Sometimes, loss can be the greatest motivator. 
 
Check out the whole interview with this inspiring family here. 

The Astin parents just released their debut album under their band name “Stell and Snuggs”, and it’s called Vela – You can listen to the whole thing here! 
 
And for tour updates, check out their site here, or like them on Facebook! Looks like they’re playing a few New York shows this month.
